data: IR Tube Insertion Management Post Procedure (Module)
Patient Care
Post Insertion Biliary Drain / Cholecystostomy Tube Care
Discharge Patient
Discharge home with extra drainage bag and follow up appointments
Monitor for Post-Procedure Bleeding
q8h
q12h
Biliary Drain Care
Biliary Drain and Cholecystostomy tubes must be connected to a drainage bag.  DO NOT attach drainage bag to immobile objects
Internal / External Biliary Drains are capped and drainage bag is required
Biliary Drain Care
Do not Irrigate biliary tube
Irrigate Biliary Tube
Irrigate with 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h, then aspirate BID
Irrigate with 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h, then aspirate Daily
Irrigate with 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h, then aspirate TID
Monitor Tube or Drain Output
q8h
q12h
Wound Care
Internal Biliary Stent requires dressing change only
Monitor Biliary Tube insertion Site dressing q2h for 8 hours
Change dressing on biliary tube insertion site PRN
Post Insertion Chest Tube Care
Chest Tube Care
Right chest tube -20 cmH2O suction
Right chest tube -40 cmH2O suction
Right chest tube to gravity
Right chest tube to under water seal
Right chest tube: Pleur-evac sahara chest drainage system care as per nursing standards
Chest Tube Care
Left chest tube -20 cmH2O suction
Left chest tube -40 cmH2O suction
Left chest tube to gravity
Left chest tube to under water seal
Left chest tube: Pleur-evac sahara chest drainage system care as per nursing standards
Clamp Chest Tube
Clamp right chest tube
Clamp Chest Tube
Clamp left chest tube
Monitor Tube or Drain Output
Monitor and record chest tube output, notify provider of sanguinous drainage over 100 mL/h or serous drainage over 1000 mL/h
Wound Care
Change chest tube drain site dressing PRN post-procedure
Leave fixation device intact at chest tube insertion site
Post Insertion Percutaneous Nephrostomy - Internal / External - Ureteric Stent / Suprapubic Cystostomy Tube Care
Discharge Patient Instructions
Give patient information pamphlet on discharge for nephrostomy
Give patient information pamphlet on discharge for ureteric stent
Monitor for Post-Procedure Bleeding
Monitor for bleeding into drainage bag post percutaneous nephrostomy OR Internal / External Ureteric Stent / Suprapubic Cystostomy insertion
Post Insertion Nephrostomy / Suprapubic / Cystostomy Care
Nephrostomy Tube Care
Keep right nephrostomy tube connected to external drainage bag.  DO NOT attach drainage bag to immobile objects
Nephrostomy Tube Care
Keep left nephrostomy tube connected to external drainage bag.  DO NOT attach drainage bag to immobile objects
Nephrostomy Tube Care
Do not irrigate nephrostomy tube
Irrigate Nephrostomy Tube
Irrigate right nephrostomy tube with 20 mL Sterile Water q12h
Irrigate Nephrostomy Tube
Irrigate left nephrostomy tube with 20 mL Sterile Water q12h
Irrigate Suprapubic Cystostomy Catheter
Irrigate with 20 mL Sterile Water q12h
Wound Care
Monitor nephrostomy insertion site dressing q1h for 4 hours
Wound Care
Change nephrostomy / suprapubic / cystostomy insertion site dressing 24-48h post-procedure, then q weekly and PRN
Post Insertion Internal - External Ureteric Stent Care
Internal-External Nephroureteral Stent Care
If persistent urine leakage around internal-external stent dressing site, uncap catheter and attach to drainage bag.  Notify provider if persistent urine leakage around dressing after 24h
Irrigate Internal-External Nephroureteral Stent
Irrigate right tube with 20 mL sterile water q12h
Irrigate Internal-External Nephroureteral Stent
Irrigate left tube with 20 mL sterile water q12h
Wound Care
Monitor Internal - External Ureteric Stent insertion site dressing q1h for 4 hours
Wound Care
Change Internal - External Ureteric Stent insertion site dressing 24 to 48 hours post-procedure, then q weekly and PRN
Post Surgical Drain Insertion for Abscess
Surgical Drain Care
Keep  connected to external drainage bag.  DO NOT attach drainage bag to immobile objects
Wound Care
Monitor surgical drain insertion site dressing q1h for 4 hours
Monitor Tube or Drain Output
q8h
q12h
Irrigate Surgical Drain
Irrigate surgical drain with 10 to 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% qdaily
Irrigate surgical drain with 10 to 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h
Irrigate surgical drain with 10 to 20 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q8h
Irrigate surgical drain with 20 to 30 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% qdaily
Irrigate surgical drain with 20 to 30 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h
Irrigate surgical drain with 20 to 30 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q8h
Irrigate surgical drain with 30 to 40 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% qdaily
Irrigate surgical drain with 30 to 40 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q12h
Irrigate surgical drain with 30 to 40 mL Sodium Chloride 0.9% q8h
Post Insertion Pericardial Drain
Cardiac Monitoring
Monitor at all times
May suspend for transport/shower
Pericardial Drain Care
Keep connected to external drainage bag.  DO NOT attach drainage bag to immobile objects
Pericardial Drain Care
Suction Type: Gravity
Wound Care
Monitor surgical drain insertion site dressing q1h for 4 hours
Change surgical drain site dressing PRN post-procedure
Monitor Tube or Drain Output
Monitor and record pericardial drain output, notify provider of sanguinous drainage over 100 mL/h or serous drainage over 500 mL/h
q4h
q8h
q12h
Post Pleural and/or Ascites Drain Insertion
Wound Care
For Pigtail, change securement devices q7day or PRN
Communication Order

For Chest Catheter, if patient experiences pain, pressure or increased coughing, stop drainage for a short period of time. Resume draining slowly when symptoms disappear. If symptoms return discontinue drainage, apply cap and dressing and contact Provider

For Abdominal Catheter, if patient experiences increased shortness of breath, increasing abdominal discomfort, nausea and/or vomiting, slow drainage and discontinue procedure as required. Contact Provider as needed
Communication Order
Notify ordering Provider if draining greater than 1000 mL/h or if signs of infection present
Communication Order
Do not Irrigate drain tube
Wound Care
Change dressing qDaily
Monitor Tube or Drain Output
q8h
q12h
Communication Order
Clamp the tube after draining _____ L
Activity
Mobilize
Mobilize with under water seal chest tube drain
Mobilize with chest tube on wall suction
Mobilize with chest tube off wall suction
Medications
If Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis is suspected:
Patients with NO penicillin or cephalosporin allergy
cefTRIAXone
2,000 mg, IV, q24h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
For severe penicillin or cephalosporin allergy (eg. anaphylaxis)
ciprofloxacin
400 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: bag
ciprofloxacin
500 mg, PO, q12h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: tab
Diagnostic Tests
For large volume paracentesis (more than 5 L): Give 100 mL of 25% albumin for each 3 L removed (including the first 5 L)
IR Tube Change Biliary
Timed, Special Instructions: Tube change required 1 week post-procedure, Order for future visit
Timed, Special Instructions: Tube change required 4 week post-procedure, Order for future visit

Timed, Special Instructions: Tube change required 4 week post-procedure, Order for future visit

Timed, Special Instructions: 24h post-procedure, Order for future visit

Timed, Special Instructions: 24h post-procedure, Order for future visit

Timed, Special Instructions: 24h post-procedure, Order for future visit

Timed, Special Instructions: Tube change required 6 weeks post-procedure, Order for future visit
Timed, Special Instructions: Tube change required 8 weeks post-procedure, Order for future visit

XR Chest
STAT, Reason: once, to rule out pneumothorax post chest tube insertion
Consults/Referrals
Home Care Consult
For education regarding post-procedure tube management
